_prev_prog_3.MD_OtherType: Ammonia Detection at Control Room and Security House

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Midway, TN

EPA I.D.:  100000229264

Risk Management Plan (RMP) Executive Summary

Facility Information: Austin Powder Inc. owns and operates US Nitrogen, LLC (USN). The US Nitrogen facility manufactures liquid ammonium nitrate solution using natural gas as the primary feedstock for the anhydrous ammonia process. The facility has four high-pressure storage vessels which store 1,600,000 pounds of anhydrous ammonia. The anhydrous ammonia storage vessels supply feeds to both the nitric acid plant and liquid ammonium nitrate plant processes.  Also, USN distributes anhydrous ammonia to customers when extra stock is available.

US Nitrogen has implemented a comprehensive program to safely manage anhydrous ammonia at the facility. Austin Powder Inc. and US Nitrogen's executive management teams have committed to full implementation of the Risk Management Plan (RMP) and Process Safety Management (PSM) programs to prevent the release of anhydrous ammonia.

The facility is subject to EPA's RMP and OSHA's PSM requirements for anhydrous ammonia. 

A PSM Compliance Manual has been developed for the facility. Key items included in the manual are:

*	Written site-specific procedures for Employee Participation, Mechanical Integrity, 
        Management of Change, Incident Investigation, Pre-Startup Safety Reviews, and Internal 
       Compliance Audits.

*	Training on PSM and its key components including Management of Change, Lockout Tagout, 
         Emergency Response and Incident Investigation.

*	Conducting Process Hazards Analyses for the ammonia processes

*	Emergency Response Plan (ERP)

*	Operator training and certification
          
The Operations Manager and Operations personnel annually review and update procedures and activities to maintain compliance with all aspects of the PSM/RMP regulations. 
          
In addition to RMP/PSM compliance, USN has implemented a number of systems to ensure the safe handling of anhydrous ammonia, including:

*	Ammonia storage vessels ha

ve dual relief valves that release to a flare system designed to 
        destroy ammonia rather than release it to atmosphere.

*	The pressurization system on the anhydrous ammonia storage vessels contains a variety of 
        controls and interlocks designed to prevent ammonia from reaching the relief valves.

The site's ERP contains considerable detail. The Operations and Maintenance staff have been trained to the Hazmat Technician standard, which allows our own employees to be able to provide an immediate response in the event of a release or spill of a hazardous material onsite.  If outside emergency services are needed, the Greeneville Fire Department's Hazmat Team is available and knowledgeable of USN's processes and hazardous chemicals onsite.  US Nitrogen maintains communication with the Greene County Director of Emergency Management to ensure that communication plans exist to alert residences that may be impacted by a release. Response Drills and exercises are coordinated with the Local Emergency Planning Committee and the local Director of Emergency Management.

In addition to PSM, the organization has an active safety program. US Nitrogen has dedicated environmental, health and safety (EHS) staff that manage the EHS programs at the facility.  US Nitrogen has a Safety Committee that continuously emphasizes safety. The committee holds regular meetings to review new safety procedures, accident investigations, safety surveys and safety communications.  Safety trainings are completed by all employees, at least monthly, via a Learning Management System, hands-on, and/or classroom.  Also, EHS audits are conducted regularly in the field to ensure employees follow the EHS Programs.
